Using

String

Mutiple String

"python" * 5 -> python python python python python

List

Add more

testList = [11, 21, 31, 41] testList + [51, 61] -> [11, 21, 31, 41, 51, 61]

testList[:2] -> [11, 21]

testList[:2] = [0, 0] -> [0, 0, 31, 41, 51, 61]

testList[:2] = [] -> [31, 41, 51, 61]

</code>

IF

if name is "henry":
print("This is henry")

Function

key word argument

def hello(name="henry", age="10"):
print("I am", name, "I am", age, "years old!")

Flexible argument

def hello(* args):
for arg in args:
pring(arg)

Directory

directory = {"name" : "henry", "age" : "10"}
for key, value in directory: print("I am " + directory["name"] + ", I am " + directory["age"] + "years old")
